description: '''Bessie Tucker''' (c. 1906 – January 6, 1933) was an American [[classic female blues]], [[country blues]], and [[Texas blues]]  [[singing|singer]] and [[songwriter]]. Little is known of her life outside the [[music industry]]. She is known to have recorded just twenty-four tracks, seven of which were alternate takes. Her songs include "Penitentiary" and "Fryin' Pan Skillet Blues".
